TopicTitle: FAR support for the Ascent Komputron

Articles.Content: If anyone's looking for a project to tackle, the Ascent Komputron is a fabulous idea that is lacking support for FAR. While it's still completely up to the original author to add this support given that the license doesn't allow anyone else to do it, perhaps he'd be willing to go for it with some help. Especially since Ferram announced a while ago that FAR would be more API accessible moving forward

Hello Gaiiden,

As you know I can't talk about this app here as it doesn't meet the forum rules, so I'll post an answer on the blog ASAP (going for a 500km drive right now!).

Cheers,

David

Hello Gaiiden,

As you know I can't talk about this app here as it doesn't meet the forum rules, so I'll post an answer on the blog ASAP (going for a 500km drive right now!).

Cheers,

David

If I may ask, what rules does it violate? It looks neat.

As you know I can't talk about this app here as it doesn't meet the forum rules, so I'll post an answer on the blog ASAP (going for a 500km drive right now!).

I wasn't aware discussion was off limits, although I do remember the take down of the original mod thread. Didn't mean to go around behind your back or anything by posting here, but I noticed you re-did the blog and removed a lot of past entries and comments. I never did see if you responded to my last comment regarding the FAR API, so I just wanted to drum up some support here and was going to tell anyone interested to just contact you through the blog.

Have a safe drive!

I just want to add my reason for pushing this again is that with Mission Architect and this software we'd have a very complete set of mission planning tools!

Edited September 14, 2014 by Gaiiden
